verses.verse: Behold <WH3303>, thou art fair, my love<WH7474>; behold<WH3303>, thou art fair; Thine eyes<WH5869> are as doves<WH3123> behind<WH1157> thy veil<WH6777>. Thy hair<WH8181> is as a flock<WH5739> of goats<WH5795>, That lie<WH1570> along the side of mount<WH2022> Gilead<WH1568>.

Thy teeth<WH8127> are like a flock<WH5739> of ewes that are newly shorn<WH7094>, Which are come up<WH5927> from the washing<WH7367>, Whereof every one hath twins<WH8382>, And none is bereaved among them<WH7909>.

Thy lips<WH8193> are like a thread<WH2339> of scarlet<WH8144>, And thy mouth<WH4057> is comely<WH5000>. Thy temples<WH7541> are like a piece<WH6400> of a pomegranate<WH7416> behind<WH1157> thy veil<WH6777>.

Thy neck<WH6677> is like the tower<WH4026> of David<WH1732> builded<WH1129> for an armory<WH8530>, Whereon there hang<WH8518> a thousand<WH505> bucklers<WH4043>, All the shields<WH7982> of the mighty men<WH1368>.
Thy two<WH8147> breasts<WH7699> are like two8147, Joshua82 fawns<WH6646> That are twins<WH8380> of a roe<WH7462>, Which feed among the lilies<WH7799>.
Until the day<WH3117> be cool<WH6315>, and the shadows<WH6752> flee away<WH5127>, I will get<WH3212> me to the mountain<WH2022> of myrrh<WH4753>, And to the hill<WH1389> of frankincense<WH3828>.
Thou art all fair<WH3303>, my love<WH7474>; And there is no spot in thee<WH3971>.

Come <WH935> with me from Lebanon<WH3844>, my bride<WH3618>, With me from Lebanon<WH3844>: Look<WH7789> from the top<WH7218> of Amana<WH549>, From the top<WH7218> of Senir<WH8149> and Hermon<WH2768>, From the lions<WH738>' dens<WH4585>, From the mountains<WH2042> of the leopards<WH5246>.
Thou hast ravished my heart<WH3823>, my sister<WH269>, my bride<WH3618>; Thou hast ravished my heart<WH3823> with one<WH259> of thine eyes<WH5869>, With one<WH259> chain<WH6060> of thy neck<WH6677>.

How fair<WH3302> is thy love<WH1730>, my sister<WH269>, my bride<WH3618>! How much better<WH2895> is thy love<WH1730> than wine<WH3196>! And the fragrance<WH7381> of thine oils<WH8081> than all manner of spices<WH1314>!

Thy lips<WH8193>, O my bride<WH3618>, drop<WH5197> as the honeycomb<WH5317>: Honey<WH1706> and milk<WH2461> are under thy tongue<WH3956>; And the smell<WH7381> of thy garments<WH8008> is like the smell<WH7381> of Lebanon<WH3844>.
A garden<WH1588> shut<WH5274> up is my sister<WH269>, my bride<WH3618>; A spring<WH1530> shut up<WH5274>, a fountain<WH4599> sealed<WH2856>.
Thy shoots<WH7973> are an orchard<WH6508> of pomegranates<WH7416>, with precious<WH4022> fruits<WH6529>; Henna<WH3724> with spikenard plants<WH5373>,

Spikenard <WH5373> and saffron<WH3750>, Calamus<WH7070> and cinnamon<WH7076>, with all trees<WH6086> of frankincense<WH3828>; Myrrh<WH4753> and aloes<WH174>, with all the chief<WH7218> spices<WH1314>.
Thou art a fountain<WH4599> of gardens<WH1588>, A well<WH875> of living<WH2416> waters<WH4325>, And flowing streams<WH5140> from Lebanon<WH3844>.

Awake <WH5782>, O north wind<WH6828>; And come<WH935>, thou south<WH8486>; Blow<WH6315> upon my garden<WH1588>, that the spices<WH1314> thereof may flow out<WH5140>. Let my beloved<WH1730> come<WH935> into his garden<WH1588>, And eat<WH398> his precious<WH4022> fruits<WH6529>.
